label: typeCode
comment: A code specifying a type of MDH health indication.

domainIncludes.comment: A collection of information specific to an item being used or reported on for supply chain trade purposes.
Any tangible output or service produced by human or mechanical effort or by a natural process for trade purposes.
A naturally occurring or designed sequence of operations or events in order to produce something.
A group of products considered or dealt with together.
A man made physical structure, such as a building, in which something is produced.
A group of supply chain trade line items, trade agreement, trade delivery and trade settlement details.
A colour of a product.
A defined set of production processes under the single management of a facility.
Any text or pattern put on the surface of a product using a specific material such as dye.
An object, especially a piece of mechanical or electronic equipment, made or adapted in order to perform a production activity.
Improving measures for manufactured components or products to meet end use requirements.
Any substance such as dyestuffs, chrome oxide, acids, sulphate, surfactant or other chemicals applied to an agricultural field, substrate, plant, animal product, material or product.
An apparatus specified to be used to perform an activity to produce something.
Distinctive or characteristic parts of a trade product.
The protocol and setting of a negotiation.
An offer exchanged between parties for an electronic negotiation.
A systematic arrangement of products in classes or categories according to established criteria.
The process of doing something in order to make something happen or to deal with a situation.
A political or physical area or region within the political boundaries of a country used or referenced for trade purposes.
An amount, size, or extent as established by measuring.
The quantity analysis for this work item.
An unattractive or unsatisfactory characteristic.
Material capable of undergoing spontaneous nuclear decay involving emission of ionizing radiation in the form of particles or gamma rays.
A significant occurrence or happening communicated by means of sending or receiving information, such as transmitting digital data by using the internet.
An organization set up on a legal basis as a business, government body, department, charity, or financial institution.
Anything that is visible or tangible, such as a product, process, or organization.
A specified period of time.
An endeavour carefully planned to achieve a procurement of goods, works and service.
A prominent attribute or aspect of a metric (a standard of measurement).
The recording of items or details for a specific legal purpose.
A prominent attribute or aspect of a document.
A series of planned activities or things to be done in this supply chain.
A distinctive or characteristic part of something.
A specified feature that is fixed for the case in question but may be different in other cases.
A row, line or series, commonly used to express the difference between lowest and highest values.
A collection of countries and/or economies united for trade purposes.
A targeted topic for debate or resolution.
The parts into which a segment is or may be divided.
A product tag device to provide protection from a peril such as theft.
A formally raised question or request for information about this specification.
A certified recognition that provides evidence of a level of competency in a given area, such as certifying a level of skill in a trade.
Improvements taken to eliminate causes of non-conformities or other undesirable situations, such as to an organization's processes or products.
An adjustment, such as a change to an organization's processes or products, taken to prevent non-conformities or other undesirable situations, possibly as a result of a risk analysis.
A referenced norm or requirement that establishes uniform criteria, methods, processes and practices, such as in engineering or technical areas.
A distinct operation or task that is part of a process.
A prominent attribute or aspect of a product.
A prominent attribute or aspect of a group of products considered or dealt with together.
Any clearly defined substance having a defined molecular composition.
A prominent attribute or aspect of an object, such as recyclability of a product, which can meet customer needs without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs.
The process of performing documented checks of sustainability characteristics, with a focus on discovering deviations, related to documented sustainability requirements.
The evaluation of an object, such as a product, process, or organization, with respect to the object's worth or condition.
A prominent technical attribute or aspect.
A permit from an authority to own or use something, do a particular thing, or to conduct a trade.
An act of notification by formal documentation or action, in any form prescribed or accepted, such as a self-declaration.
The process of performing documented checks, such as on materials or processes, with a focus on discovering deviations, errors or faults related to documented requirements.
The recording of items or details for a governmental purpose.
A set of measurable factors that specifies the conditions of its operation within a specific context.
A set of measurable factors that specifies the conditions within which an entity operates correctly.
A significant occurrence or happening related to an inspection.
A feature that is fixed for the case in question but may be different in other cases for this observation objective.
Common conditions contained in a contract or agreement applicable between trading partners.
A state that applies to a product characteristic.
A prominent attribute or aspect of an organization.
A distinctive feature of a material contained within physical goods.
A substance from which something is or could be made.
A process of either regaining substances in usable form, or of getting rid of substances regarding waste material, such as production waste.
Any materials unused and rejected as unwanted during a production process.
A production material component that is unused and rejected as unwanted.
A process of either regaining waste substances in usable form, or of getting rid of waste substances resulting from production.
The information that enables the reconciliation of a payment with the item(s) that the payment is intended to settle, for example a commercial invoice.
A specific business arrangement whereby monetary values pertaining to payment, collected or paid, are recorded.
Coins, banknotes paid by the recipient of goods or services to the provider.
A written payment order to a bank to pay the stated sum from the drawer's account.
The use of online and digital technologies to collect monetary payment amounts.
A card used to represent a financial account for a trade settlement.
An institution that provides financial services and financial transactions for payment.
A detailed statement of work, prices, and dimensions for this valuation.
A basic item of work.
A grouping of related work items.
A printed piece of paper or an electronic document that can be used instead of money to pay for an experience, such as a tour, a trip or a meal in a restaurant.
A cross-border trade related assessment of the worth of an object, such as its monetary value, for customs purposes.
A practice of cultivating land, raising crops, or treatment of the agricultural produce.
A method or substance, such as chemical fertilizers and crop protection products, applied to plant growth whilst managing and controlling diseases and pests.
A group of crop produce considered or dealt with together.
Agricultural plants or plant products grown and harvested, such as grain, fruit, vegetables, silage.
A prominent attribute or aspect of an agricultural object.
The keeping of an animal in a particular location.
Any type of action, such as searching, reserving, or paying, necessary for an experience program, such as an adventure experience, a business experience, or a wellness experience.
A structure or place, such as a restaurant, hotel, theme park, hot spring bathing pool, parking lot, or meeting room, that provides a particular experience.
A guest condition of the abnormal reaction of the body to a previously encountered substance introduced by inhalation, ingestion, injection, or skin contact.
A tool or device carried by a guest for an activity.
A physical or mental condition that limits a guest's movements, senses, or activities.
A guest's decision which food to buy or eat.
A guest's physical or mental condition.
Specified privately owned articles for personal use by an individual.
A significant occurrence or happening during transport.,A referenced significant occurrence or happening during transport.

A calculation of the pollution (including noise, heat, and radiation etc.) discharged into the environment by a residential, commercial, or industrial facility or by a means of transport, such as a vessel, aircraft or truck.
Any wrapping or containment, such as a box or a barrel, whether or not any goods are contained within.
Any materials unused and rejected as unwanted resulting from transportation.
An unused and rejected as unwanted component of transport material resulting from transportation.
Sanitary measures as reported for a WHO MDH (Maritime Declaration of Health).
Information related to a specific transportation indication to be reported on a WHO MDH (Maritime Declaration of Health).
An IOT (Internet of Things) piece of mechanical or electronic equipment which can collect, report and autonomously transmit digital data.
A stores item, such as for onboard use during a journey.
A process of either regaining substances in usable form, or of getting rid of substances resulting from transportation.
An object which can detect and measure physical properties and which can record, indicate and transmit such measurements.
The identification of related information in a supply chain context.
A significant occurrence or happening in a supply chain.
Hardware or software typically marketed by a company other than the original manufacturer.
